name: NPR
text:
In his new book, CNN's Brian Stelter says President Trump's "cozy" relationship with Sean Hannity is "like nothing we've seen in American history" ‚Äî and describes the president as a "shadow producer" for the Fox News host.
https://t.co/32jlfdiZ2x

name: NPR
text:
Speaking at #RNC2020, Navajo Nation Vice President Myron Lizer offered praise for President Trump and Supreme Court Justice Neil Gorsuch.

It comes a week after Jonathan Nez ‚Äî¬†Navajo Nation president ‚Äî spoke in a keynote in support of Joe Biden at the DNC. https://t.co/tuPElm4f9A

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden had a former Republican governor of Ohio and a Republican former secretary of state speak at the DNC.

President Trump has had a Democratic state representative from Georgia, and the Democratic mayor of Eveleth, Minn. ‚Äî population 3,718.
https://t.co/I77tkR8web

name: NPR
text:
A bevy of speakers‚Äîincluding some prominent nonwhite Republicans‚Äîhave mounted a defense of Trump‚Äôs record on race relations.

But the convention has also featured speakers who've accused protesters fighting for racial justice of being violent extremists. https://t.co/4cfqDYLFTN

name: NPR
text:
The University of Alabama is reporting more than 560 new COVID-19 cases across its 3 campuses and medical center less than a week after starting in-person classes.
https://t.co/icTsh6vhfW

name: NPR
text:
The Ohio State University has temporarily suspended more than 200 students who hosted or attended parties of 10 or more people without practicing physical distancing or wearing face coverings.
https://t.co/9OtkrycKlK

name: NPR
text:
The RNC showed a naturalization ceremony for five new citizens.

The moment aimed to show Trump looking presidential ‚Äî and is likely to incense critics over his refusal to draw a hard line between official White House business and running for reelection. https://t.co/PZE2ryVYaJ

name: NPR
text:
Ammon Bundy, who led an armed standoff against federal agents in Oregon in 2016, was arrested at the Idaho state capitol for trespassing and refusing to leave following an apparent protest Tuesday.
https://t.co/kLCZfxExDD

name: NPR
text:
Here's a little history on the White House Rose Garden, the backdrop of first lady Melania Trump‚Äôs prime-time speech at the RNC.
https://t.co/yg2NpA27IB

name: NPR
text:
The House Foreign Affairs Committee‚Äôs panel on oversight informed the State Department that it is launching an investigation into Mike Pompeo‚Äôs RNC speech, which sparked concern about possible law violations for public servants.
https://t.co/pFBmAUcdR2

name: NPR
text:
‚ÄúMr. Vice President, look at me. I am Black,‚Äù Kentucky AG Daniel Cameron said, addressing Joe Biden directly. ‚ÄúWe are not all the same, sir. I am not in chains. My mind is my own, and you can‚Äôt tell me how to vote because of the color of my skin.‚Äù
https://t.co/beZGQJcrRY

name: NPR
text:
A Kentucky man accused of breaking Canada's COVID-19 quarantine order (twice) could be forced to pay a $569,000 fine and spend up to 6 months in prison ‚Äî or both.
https://t.co/x96bsR0wtI

name: NPR
text:
Actor Sterling K. Brown sees the record number of Black performers nominated for Emmys as part of a long march toward recognition.

 "It's taken a long time to be fully recognized as human in front of the camera and in life." https://t.co/hPtBQ94R6S

name: NPR
text: COVID-19 has become the latest in a series of disruptions to global supply chains ‚Äî pushing companies to reevaluate how and where their products are getting made. https://t.co/cOADSqnpjU

name: NPR
text:
Jacob Blake, the Black man who was shot multiple times at close range by police in Kenosha, Wis., is currently paralyzed from the waist down, according to the family's lawyer.
https://t.co/KdwlwSiuwB

name: NPR
text:
For years, Exxon Mobil was the largest publicly traded company. 

But starting next week, the oil giant will be be dropped from the Dow ‚Äî a symbolic shift representing how Exxon, once a corporate titan, has diminished in stature.
https://t.co/QBLmxnZU7y

name: NPR
text:
Sarah and Andy were sleeping in their home when a massive wildfire arrived earlier than expected. They lost their house, and several of the goats they raise.

Andy ‚Äî a veteran firefighter of more than 20 years ‚Äî says he's never seen any fire like it.
https://t.co/ucZShKVxb6

name: NPR
text:
Africa has declared that wild polio has been eradicated. 

The WHO says the eradication campaign prevented an estimated 1.8 million cases of paralysis in children and saved approximately 180,000 lives.
https://t.co/9ToVdPVsOL

name: NPR
text:
Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko tried to offset Kremlin pressure earlier this year by pursuing rapprochement with Western nations.

But as he faces mass protests calling for his resignation, he has again turned to Russia.
https://t.co/1oiSwJ4Tor

name: NPR
text:
Researchers in Germany simulated a stadium concert to collect data on crowd behavior to understand how COVID-19 spreads at large events ‚Äî and how to prevent it.
https://t.co/vIWrzPFqcf

name: NPR
text:
Three people were shot, two fatally, during protests in Kenosha, Wis., following the police shooting of Jacob Blake. The county sheriff said at least one person, a white male, opened fire on protesters with a long gun.
https://t.co/XcJHA6ARK2

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: Opened 50 years ago today by Jimi Hendrix, Electric Lady Studios broke the mold for what a recording studio could be. https://t.co/oMon4uwOdY

name: NPR
text:
The White House legal counsel has underscored that it doesn't apply to the president and vice president.

But up until now, members of both parties have taken pains to avoid conducting overtly political actions on federal property. https://t.co/rMV4gMO9NL

name: NPR
text:

But up until now, members of both parties have taken pains to avoid conducting overtly political actions on federal property. https://t.co/rMV4gMO9NL

text:

text:

We'll see you in the chat: https://t.co/dzRABdvsRC

name: NPR
text:
Ask any Republican strategist about the state of their party in 2020 and you'll get an answer like this one from GOP consultant Antonia Ferrier:

"This is Donald Trump's party." 
https://t.co/qLoNF4k1Ex

name: NPR
text: Forecasters project that Hurricane Laura could cause  "unsurvivable" storm surge in some coastal areas near the Texas-Louisiana border ‚Äî impacting areas up to 30 miles inland. https://t.co/vBp62637Xy

name: NPR
text: Forecasters project that Hurricane Laura could cause "unsurvivable" storm surge in some coastal areas near the Texas-Louisiana border ‚Äî impacting areas up to 30 miles inland. https://t.co/x6aUxSVKDO

name: NPR
text:
Billie Eilish and her brother Finneas have accomplished what no one has been able to do for five and a half months: perform a Tiny Desk concert in what certainly appears to be the NPR Music offices.

Watch to experience the extent of the technical feat:
https://t.co/zh5n9Lj7Zx

name: NPR
text:
Even after the 19th amendment took effect, millions of people were still excluded from the vote.

In the face of racist opposition, white suffragists betrayed the Black women who'd also fought for the right to vote, says author Elaine Weiss. https://t.co/RWZhkaX2S6

name: NPR
text: "We really can't claim that the United States had an incredible victory in 1920, when in 2020 there are still far too many barriers for people to vote," says a professor of history and African American studies. https://t.co/iV25IGTgqr

name: NPR
text:
The Hatch Act prohibits federal employees from engaging in most political activity inside federal buildings or while on duty.  

Though the president and vice president are exempt from its civil provisions, Mike Pompeo and Chad Wolf are not. https://t.co/usxarryAw0

name: NPR
text:
The Trump campaign is putting Pence's Midwestern sensibilities to work again to assure evangelicals and social conservatives that the president is a man of faith ‚Äî a better choice to look out for their interests than Joe Biden.
https://t.co/IXojMPayyj

name: NPR
text:
For the first time, a real estate website is telling prospective buyers about the flood risk for millions of homes ‚Äî and how climate change could increase that risk in the coming decades. 
https://t.co/Tq56gmfubl

name: NPR
text:
Young athletes ‚Äî especially girls ‚Äî can struggle with a breathing condition frequently misdiagnosed as asthma. While it may look like asthma, the real cause of the problem is in the vocal cords.
https://t.co/t9cefvpha9

name: NPR
text: The FBI says it has no evidence of any coordinated fraud schemes related to voting by mail ‚Äî contradicting repeated unverified claims by President Trump and Attorney General William Barr. https://t.co/jb2rbxxqKQ

name: NPR
text:
As the presidential election draws closer, NPR wants to hear what kinds of issues matter most to California voters between the ages of 18 and 24.üëá
https://t.co/u3clOna1C9

name: NPR
text:
Germany lawmakers banned prostitution amid the pandemic to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. 

But sex workers say the closure of legal brothels has meant the sudden loss of income ‚Äî and put the workers' lives in danger.  https://t.co/ooLgdM4COg

name: NPR
text:
FDA Commissioner Stephen Hahn apologized after using a deeply misleading statistic that over-hyped the benefits of convalescent plasma. 

It's not the first time he's mischaracterized scientific findings to support Trump administration talking points.
https://t.co/nF9Pd0FMl5
